intro: Gonolobus broadwayae, commonly known as the Broadway morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering vines. The species is named in honor of the American botanist and horticulturist, Dr. James Broadway.
